scheme_name: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
description: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) is a flagship health assurance scheme by the Government of India, launched in 2018, aiming for Universal Health Coverage. It provides a health cover of ₹5,00,000 per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization to over 10.74 crore poor and vulnerable families (bottom 40% of the Indian population). Eligibility is based on deprivation and occupational criteria from the Socio-Economic Caste Census 2011 (SECC 2011). The scheme is fully funded by the Government, with costs shared between Central and State Governments.
benefits: Cashless cover of up to ₹5,00,000 per eligible family per annum for listed secondary and tertiary care conditions.
Benefits are on a family floater basis, with no cap on family size or the age of members.
Pre-existing diseases are covered from the very first day.
Covers medical examination, treatment, and consultation.
Covers non-intensive and intensive care services.
Covers post-hospitalization follow-up care up to 15 days.
eligibility: **Rural Beneficiaries (based on SECC 2011 deprivation criteria):**
Families with only one room with kucha walls and kucha roof.
Households with no adult member between ages 16 to 59.
Households with no adult male member between ages 16 to 59.
Households with a disabled member and no able-bodied adult member.
SC/ST households.
Landless households deriving a major part of their income from manual casual labour.
Destitute/living on alms, manual scavenger households, primitive tribal groups, legally released bonded labour (automatic inclusion).
**Urban Beneficiaries (based on 11 occupational categories):**
Ragpickers, Beggars, Domestic workers.
Street vendors, Cobblers, Hawkers, or other service providers working on streets.
Construction workers, Plumbers, Masons, Labourers, Painters, Welders, Security guards, Coolies, and other head-load workers.
Sweepers, Sanitation workers, Malis.
Home-based workers, Artisans, Handicrafts workers, Tailors.
Transport workers, Drivers, Conductors, Helpers to drivers and conductors, Cart pullers, Rickshaw pullers.
Shop workers, Assistants, Peons in small establishments, Helpers, Delivery assistants, Attendants, Waiters.
Electricians, Mechanics, Assemblers, Repair workers.
Washer-men, Chowkidars.
Any family that has an active RSBY card as of 28 February 2018 is covered.
**Exclusions (not eligible):**
Those who own a two, three, or four-wheeler or a motorized fishing boat.
Those who own mechanized farming equipment.
Those who have Kisan cards with a credit limit of ₹50,000/-.
Those employed by the government or working in government-managed non-agricultural enterprises.
Those earning a monthly income above ₹10,000/-.
Those owning refrigerators and landlines.
Those with decent, solidly built houses.
Those owning 5 acres or more of agricultural land.
documents: Age & Identity Proof (Aadhaar Card / PAN Card)
Document Proof of the Current Status of the Family (Joint or Nuclear)
